description.originalText: We love savannah. She is so intentional and respectful- a real parenting partner.  She is a better gentle parent than I am, and she is very graceful and cooperative. She practices open communication with the kids and parents. I can’t say enough good things. We trust her and we love her, and it’s very hard to say goodbye to having her in our day-to-day lives. But we won’t say a real goodbye - we’re too bonded now.

description.displayText: Savannah is a thoughtful, skilled, professional, dependable, delightful caregiver! She provided care to my four children ages 3, 7, 9 and 11 and split her time between two households. Her duties included meal prep, light cleaning as it related to kiddo activities/food prep, chore delegation, and of course - interacting with and entertaining the kids. She is a true problem solver and would bring possible solutions to the table as we navigated a separation and dealt with neurodiversity/special needs with one of our children. Her communication skills are excellent, and I would highly recommend her to any family looking for someone to take an active role in their family.

description.displayText: Savannah's been in integral part of our family and has mentored our child from age 1-2. It was important for us to hire someone who loves nature, is open to playing in all kinds of weather, and shows up fully for not only the physical needs but also the social and emotional needs of our child. Savannah is present, consistent, thoughtful, reliable, grounded, compassionate, articulate, playful, active, imaginative, creative, and has an ability to hold the space of loving compassion and consistent boundaries. Sharing strategies, aligning together to create stability, balance, consistency with discipline, responding to changing developmental needs, potty training, and sharing the joys and challenges that came up during the day built trust, resiliency, and a deep feeling of mutual support. These qualities have been an asset to our child's ability to thrive during the toddler years. We hope our transition provides another family with the opportunity to be cared for in such meaningful ways.

description.displayText: Savannah has been an integral part of our family. She deeply cares and is extremely dependable.
description.originalText: Savannah has been an integral part of our family. She deeply cares and is extremely dependable.

description.displayText: Savannah connected to all four of my kids, ranging in age from 4 to 15 years old. I just asked my four year old what he liked about Savannah and he said "we had so much good times together" and that is totally true. She is super fun and responsible and has a special place in our hearts. We still keep in touch with her and are grateful for the time she spent with us.
